info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
info.description:
At 06:30 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near RAKAIA, HORORATA, LAURISTON, CHERTSEY, TE PIRITA, PENDARVES and DROMORE.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the east, and are expected to lie near RAKAIA, HORORATA, CHERTSEY and PENDARVES at 07:00 pm and near RAKAIA, SOUTHBRIDGE, DUNSANDEL, LEESTON, SELWYN and RAKAIA HUTS at 07:30 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by torrential rain, large hail, possible tornadoes and frequent lightning.
Impact:
Torrential rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, and make driving conditions hazardous.
Tornadoes can blow out windows, lift roofs, break large branches off trees, generate dangerous flying debris and blow vehicles off the road.
Frequent lightning is dangerous to people and livestock, especially those exposed outdoors or on the water, and can cause power surges and damage to electrical equipment.
